title: Harmonization Information
text: all_drugs dataset agglomeration self-reported drugs, drugs found urine drug screening alcohol screening ctn_0027, ctn_0030, ctn_0051. data result extensive preprocessing free text harmonize drug names, drugs collapsed groups. example, many descriptions, abbreviations, spellings variants suboxone (e.g., “street suboxone”, “bup/nx”, “buxnx”, “bupnx”, “pbupnx”, “bupxx”) harmonized single “suboxone” group suboxone collapsed buprenorphine formulations. many spellings text variants (including mg location drug administered), list Table 1 summarizes additional text changes made free text entries. Many free text entries included combination two drugs. cases, record created drug. example, free text entry ‘Amitiptyline & Trazadone’ (literal incorrect spelling record used example) converted two records: ‘Tryclic-antidepressant’ ‘Antidepressant’. Table 1: Recoded Free Text Descriptions Drugs. timeline-followback (TLFB) data many dozens typos dates., nearly fixed looking form completion dates dates problematic records. ctn_0030, nearly 40 problematic dates, one fixed record dropped. ctn_0051 stored TLFB data two files. One file contained start stop dates baseline TLFB assessment. second contained results day. files occasionally inconsistent. Five start/stop records modified based randomization data dated data. Urine drug screening (UDS) records also many date problems. ctn_0027, approximately 100 records UDS screening dates problematic. dozen problematic dates ctn_0030. unambiguously fixed using dated records form date stamps. Self-reported drug information TLFB ctn_0027 allowed free-text entry substance. TLFB ctn_0030 ctn_0051 used structured questions assess use alcohol drugs. Specifically, TLFB ctn_0030 checked drugs listed Table 2. allowed free-text entry opiates, abused substances unknown. Frequently appearing “opiates” included “Suboxone”, “Buprenorphine”, “Darvocet” “Fentanyl.” CTN-51 used comprehensive set drugs listed Table 2 allowed two additional drugs per day. Frequently occurring free text drugs ctn_0051 included: Fioricet, Adderall, Baclofen, K2/Spice, Codeine, Fentanyl, Kratom, Bath Salts, Gabapentin, PCP, Ambien. Table 2: Drugs Assessed ctn_0030 ctn_0051 Timeline Followback Questionnaires. participants (= 116,166, 250, 934, 1331, 3325) TLFB data last date treatment drug included treatment medication (buprenorphine). See all_drugs additional details/information.

title: Harmonization Information
text: ctn_0051 consistently gathered self-reported drug use urine drug screening (UDS) data buprenorphine even prescribed, ctn_0027 ctn_0030 . rare cases subject ctn_0027 ctn_0030 self-reported taking drugs prescribed part trial, records left dataset. Analysts proceed caution unclear data entry issues people supplementing prescribed drugs. ctn_0027 self-reports buprenorphine 16 people self-reported methadone least prescribed . accounted 112 100,000 self-reported drug events ctn_0027. ctn_0030, suboxone use self-reported, prescription, six people (eight problematic records tens thousands drug use events). ctn_0027 include buprenorphine UDS, ctn_0030 scheduled screenings (phase 1 week 10 12/final visits phase 2 week 22 24/final visits) ctn_0051 consistently checked . many buprenorphine UDS screenings ctn_0030 week 10, 12, 22 24 (N = 40). Nearly always, seem duplicates “final visit” records. Analysts proceed caution looking UDS records buprenorphine ctn_0030.

title: Harmonization Information
text: timeline followback data ctn_0027 included free text descriptions number alcoholic beverages consumed day. Free text included entries ran gamut casual drinking (e.g., “1/2 beer birthday”), heavy drinking (e.g., “3 16oz beer, 1 shot hard alcohol, 1 mixed drink”), dangerous quantities (e.g., “6pk beer & 1/2 gal. rum”). entries converted standard drinks using information National Institute Alcohol Abuse Alcoholism, Wikipedia. Bartending references used estimate number shots contained larger containers. Ambiguous entries like “many glasses wine” coded five standard drinks. women, half standard drink less four standard drinks considered light drinking day. men, half standard drink less five considered light drinking day. ctn_0027 less eight people marked drinking something particular day details provided. drinking records person reviewed. Four people alcohol use, records dropped. Three others history light alcohol use problematic days marked light drinking one person unambiguous history heavy drinking, therefore unknown day marked heavy drinking. See all_drugs additional details/information.

title: Harmonization Information
text: Baseline pain assessed using SF-36 ctn_0027 ctn_0030 using EuroQoL CTN-51. SF-36 responses question “much bodily pain past 4 weeks?” aggregated three categories “Pain”, “mild Moderate Pain”, “Severe Pain”. EuroQoL ask respondents rank “Pain/discomfort” one three categories. levels labeled using categories described .

title: Harmonization Information
text: medical history assessment three trails included: schizophrenia, depression, bipolar disorder, anxiety (anxiety grouped panic disorder ctn_0027 ctn_0030), brain damage, epilepsy. ctn_0027 ctn_0030 gathered psychiatric symptoms using DSM-4 criteria, ctn_0051 used DSM-5 criteria. CTN-027 checked diagnosis dependency opiates, alcohol, amphetamines, cannabis, cocaine, sedatives, benzodiazepines, dependence depressants, dependence stimulants. ctn_0030 scored people diagnosis dependency opiates.

title: Harmonization Information
text: date information administration treatment drugs required extensive processing find fix problematic dates. Many algorithms used identify problems. included: treatment dates far randomization identifying dates past end study period duplicate dates problematic dates identified, data manually reviewed try find gaps medication history. Nearly always values found typos year month. cases, dates fixed. ctn_0027 250 typos 10 fixed unambiguously. ctn_0030 approximately two dozen typos, two fixed. records fixed dropped. One person ctn_0030 multiple drug records date. lower mg records deleted. ctn_0027 approximately 100 data entry problems mislabeling drug administered random days. , source data, subjects listed receiving single dose methadone, mg appropriate buprenorphine, middle dozens hundreds doses buprenorphine. Similar mistakes happened people receiving methadone. mislabeling mistakes fixed.

title: Harmonization Information
text: Urine Drug Screening (UDS) protocols identical across three trials. Table 5 shows details tested. Note table many opiates grouped “Opioid” category Amphetamine Methamphetamine grouped “Amphetamine”. -grouped data can found all_drugs table. Table 5: Drugs Assessed UDS Trials Grouping Categories. See section all_drugs additional details.

title: Harmonization Information
text: Missed visits ctn_0027 missing appointment dates visit week. ctn_0027 ctn_0030 logged reasons missed appointments free text. ctn_0051 categorized reasons missing appointments 10 groups plus “” categorized. reasons harmonized set 14 excuse categories. free text scanned key words/phrases (including frequently occurring misspellings) converted indicator variables shown Table 6. Table 6: Reasons Attending Appointments.

title: Harmonization Information
text: Note ctn_0027 ctn_0030 used Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale (COWS) ctn_0051 used Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale (SOWS) assess withdrawal symptoms. COWS makes distinction moderately severe severe withdrawal, SOWS . Therefore, combine severe moderately severe categories label “severe”.

title: Harmonization Information
text: Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale (COWS)
code: select;         when(score >= 37) withdrawl = 3; * severe;         when(score >= 25) withdrawl = 3; * moderately severe same as severe;         when(score >= 13) withdrawl = 2; * moderate;         when(score >= 5)  withdrawl = 1; * mild;         when(score >= 0)  withdrawl = 0; * none;     end;

title: Harmonization Information
text: Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale (COWS)
code: select;         when(score >= 37) withdrawl = 3; * severe;         when(score >= 25) withdrawl = 3; * moderately severe same as severe;         when(score >= 13) withdrawl = 2; * moderate;         when(score >= 5)  withdrawl = 1; * mild;         when(score >= 0)  withdrawl = 0; * none;      end;

title: Harmonization Information
text: Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale (SOWS)
code: select;             when (score >= 21) withdrawl = 3; * severe;             when (score >= 11) withdrawl = 2; * moderate;             when (score >= 1)  withdrawl = 1; * mild;             when (score = 0)   withdrawl = 0; * none;             when (score = .)   withdrawl = .;         end;

title: Authors and Citation
text: Balise R, Odom G, Calderon (2023). public.ctn0094data: De-Identified Data CTN-0094. R package version 1.0.6, https://ctn-0094.github.io/public.ctn0094data/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {public.ctn0094data: De-Identified Data from CTN-0094},   author = {Raymond Balise and Gabriel Odom and Anna Calderon},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 1.0.6},   url = {https://ctn-0094.github.io/public.ctn0094data/}, }

title: De-Identified Data from CTN-0094
text: harmonized/normalized data sets produced part Clinical Trials Network (CTN) protocol number 0094. data describe experiences care seeking individuals suffering opioid use disorder (OUD). US National Institute Drug Abuse (NIDA) funded project; learn go https://ctnlibrary.org/protocol/ctn0094/. datasets data harmonized : CTN-0027 (https://ctnlibrary.org/protocol/ctn0027/), CTN-0030 (https://ctnlibrary.org/protocol/ctn0030/), CTN-0051 (https://ctnlibrary.org/protocol/ctn0051/). lists data tables summaries contents, please see “Harmonization Information” vignette.

title: De-Identified Data from CTN-0094
text: currently submitting package CRAN. accepted, able install released version public.ctn0094data CRAN : now, can use remotes package install database directly GitHub :

title: De-Identified Data from CTN-0094
text: expect paper corresponding package published shortly PLOS One. expected citation Balise RR, Hu MC, Odom GJ, Calderon , Luo SX, Feaster DJ, CTN-0094 Team. (submission, expected 2024). “Harmonization ‘High Stakes’ Clinical Trial Data: Medication Assisted Treatment Opioid Use Disorder.” PLOS One. find citation information package, call following code:

title: Metadata About UDS Groupings — meta_substance_groups_uds
text: table indicates substances screened trial. first column (substance) drawn labels appear case report forms three clinical trials. remaining three columns hold "" substance screened trial, grouping label indicating type drug screened. ungrouped data can found all_drugs. example, "Opiate 300 ng" "Oxycodone" assigned grouping label "Opioid", assessed clinical trial (none rows show ""). contrast, "Opiate 2000 ng" also assigned grouping label "Opioid", neither assessed ctn_0027 ctn_0030; thus, grouping label "" trials. details, see Harmonization Information vignette.

title: Psychiatric History — psychiatric
text: Information psychiatric symptoms diagnoses. constructs measured using different instruments. example, Addition Severity Index (ASI) asks "significant period time (direct result drug/alcohol use) experienced hallucinations - saw things heard voices people hear see?" medical psychiatric history evaluation asks schizophrenia. definitions substance abuse changed American Psychiatric Association's Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders. Also see Harmonization Information vignette details.

title: Psychiatric History — psychiatric

title: Patient Visit Data — visit
text: contains planned visits. appointments kept. Indicator variables show reasons missed appointment (known). data simple.  1300+ dates duplicated different visit types.  week 24 visits happen wrong time (e.g., date week 24 week 8).  also many cases two adjacent visits happen day (e.g., week 7 week 8 visits day). visit visit reports day people. nearly 850 “Cross Active Study” visits 43 happen date another visit. Many variables "1" indicating "Yes".  NA know values real "" actually "Unknown". Proceed great caution.
